alert.note: Alert for Estill; Lee; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Powell, Estill, northwestern Breathitt, northern Lee and western Wolfe Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winston to Pine Ridge. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pine Ridge, Jenson, Koomer Ridge Campground, Rogers, Glencairn, Torrent, Natural Bridge S.P., Slade, Zachariah and Leeco around 345 PM EDT. Whisman around 350 PM EDT. High Falls, Calaboose and Booth around 355 PM EDT. Campton, Fincastle and Grannie around 400 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Irvine, Stillwater, North Irvine, Ravenna, Vortex, Baptist, South Irvine, Simpson, Lane, Hollonville, Mary, Bethany, Blanton Flats, Flat, Wagersville, Landsaw and Drip Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
